description.h2: An element used in a fact or xbrldi:explicitMember in an instance must have at most one label for any combination of the xlink:role attribute and the xml:lang attribute in the DTS of that instance.
description.p: An element "has a label" in a DTS if there is an effective arc with the defining xsd:element source, an xlink:arcrole attribute equal to 'http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label' and target link:label with an xml:lang attribute starting with 'en'.

This rule is particularly relevant to elements declared in the company schema, because a document that could contain a link:label for a company-specific element would never appear in a standard taxonomy, and therefore has to be in a label linkbase in the same submission.

variation.name: 6.10.2, fact and member used have various labels in en-US and fr, GOOD.
variation.description: fact and member used have various labels in en-US and fr, GOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.2, unused elements have multiple standard labels in en-US, GOOD.
variation.description: unused elements have multiple standard labels in en-US, GOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.2, standard element dei:EntityRegistrantName used in fact has duplicate en-US standard label, NOGOOD.
variation.description: standard element dei:EntityRegistrantName in fact has duplicate en-US standard label, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.2, custom element 'Promises' used in fact has duplicate fr standard label, NOGOOD.
variation.description: custom element 'Promises' used in fact has duplicate fr standard label, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.2, custom element used in fact has duplicate en-US non-standard label, NOGOOD.
variation.description: custom element used in fact has duplicate en-US non-standard label, NOGOOD.
